qas.question: What entity controlled the Prussian army?
What was the unique purpose of the Prussian Army during peacetime?

answers.text: to prepare the overall war strategy

qas.question: The officers of the General Staff were hand-selected from which place?
What new technologies in particular were courted by Moltke?

context: The Prussian army was controlled by <a0_0>the General Staff<a0_0/>, under <a1_0>Field Marshal Helmuth von Moltke<a1_0/>. The Prussian army was unique in Europe for having the only such organisation in existence, whose purpose in peacetime was <a2_0>to prepare the overall war strategy<a2_0/>, and in wartime to direct operational movement and organise logistics and communications. The officers of the General Staff were hand-picked from the <a3_0>Prussian Kriegsakademie (War Academy)<a3_0/>. Moltke embraced new technology, particularly <a4_0>the railroad and telegraph<a4_0/>, to coordinate and accelerate mobilisation of large forces.
